> 
> Sweet! So possibly a balloon capable of carrying a Mk1 pod up really high for a Red Bull Stratos recreation?

It will be as simple as editing the lift values in the config, similar to editing an engine's thrust

I am currently re-writing the entire code for the balloon module to not only work more efficiently but also to make it much easier to customise in the config. 

It is almost done (by done, I mean the level at which the current module is at)

> 
> I am currently re-writing the entire code for the balloon module to not only work more efficiently but also to make it much easier to customise in the config. 
> It is almost done (by done, I mean the level at which the current module is at)

Another update:

Dealing with a lot of bugs right now trying to implement this new code, could be a few days before I get it done.

**This mod is not dead**, I am still working on it - just not much to show recently.

I am still rewriting the code, it's a pain - a ton of really weird bugs - but slowly but surely I am getting there.

Development will be on hold as **I am going away** to Tanzania and will not be back until **14/08/15**, and I am away the following week.

This means development will probably not resume until about **20/08/15**.

I would also like to pre-warn that, from **September**, development *may* be a bit slower as I will have less free time (sixth form)
Safe journey, we shall wait impatiently for this promising mod.

> I would also like to pre-warn that, from **September**, development *may* be a bit slower as I will have less free time (sixth form)

Assuming that you go on to do something STEM related, this mod would look great on a UCAS application form. Good luck OP.

Hiya!

Are you thinking of doing super-big weather balloons? I know you've said that you wanna keep them science based and they aren't meant to be lifting fuel tanks, but NASA did recently lift an SRB and a huge heatshield which was about 5m across, so it'd be cool to do parts contracts with them or something ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Have a nice trip!

Seconding the "wishing for heavy payload weather balloons" thing- rigging 40 something of the little ones together on a truss to lift a couple sensors and a parachute isn't exactly economical, and I know you can get off-the-shelf balloons in real life that lift way more than .005 metric tons. (They're expensive, but you can get them) That's even before you get into airships and hot air balloons. (Incidentally, both of those would be nice too. X3)
Looks good. Smells good. Should be on CKAN ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)

I don't usually poke authors for updates but in this case I have stated multiple times over the past 2 months on my twitter account plans to use these balloons in Sept/Oct and I would like to know if that would still be possible. I downloaded the first release but after going to the pad and inflating the balloon it never left the ground... I have no problems if this mod is on official hiatus but I'd like to know so I can stop planning to use it later down the road if that's the case, until it comes back under active development. Thanks!

This is awesome. I actually think about to build a reallife weatherballon. This mod comes in very handy ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Because I kept getting issues that were difficult to get around, and to make this mod easier to edit, I am rebuilding from the ground up.

First up was a slightly updated model as seen here:

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/vYXBV)

Keep checking back for updates and thanks for being patient.
